abstract: The richest Americans give a greater share of their income to charities than low- and middle-income Americans, but the mix of beneficiaries is different.
snippet: The richest Americans give a greater share of their income to charities than low- and middle-income Americans, but the mix of beneficiaries is different.
lead_paragraph: The richest Americans give a greater share of their income to charities than low- and middle-income Americans do, but the mix of beneficiaries is decidedly different, according to congressional testimony from Frank J. Sammartino, the assistant director for tax analysis from the Congressional Budget Office.

headline.main: Which Americans Are Most Generous, and to Whom
